# Flight Test Brevity Codes {#sec-flighttestbrevity}

This table consists of a couple dozen flight test brevity codes that resolve many of the most common test team communication issues.

+------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Correct Term                                                           | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                         | Typical Error                                                                                                                                                        | Effect of Error                                                                                                                                                                                                            | Plain English Antidote                                                                                                                                                                                              |

| "RADIO CHECK"                                                          | I'm requesting that you tell me how well you can hear my transmission on UHF PRIME                                                                                              | Calling from AUX or VHF                                                                                                                                              | Aircrew think you're calling on UHF PRIME but you're actually on VHF or UHF AUX                                                                                                                                            | "How do you hear me on UHF PRIME?"                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| "RADIO CHECK ON AUX"                                                   | I'm requesting that you tell me how well you can hear my transmission on the auxiliary (either UHF2 or VHF).                                                                    | 1.  "RADIO CHECK"                                                                                                                                                    | 1.  Aircrew think you're calling on UHF PRIME                                                                                                                                                                              | "How do you hear me on \[UHF/AUX/VHF\]?"                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2.   Accidentally calling from UHF PRIME                                                                                                                             | 2.  Aircrew think you're calling on VHF or UHF AUX but you're actually on UHF PRIME                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| "RADIO CHECK ON VICTOR"                                                | I'm requesting that you tell me how well you can hear my transmission on VHF                                                                                                    | 1.  "RADIO CHECK"                                                                                                                                                    | 1.  Aircrew think you're calling on UHF PRIME                                                                                                                                                                              | "How do you hear me on VHF?"                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2.   Accidentally calling from UHF PRIME                                                                                                                             | 2.  Aircrew think you're calling on VHF or UHF AUX but you're actually on UHF PRIME                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| "\[Control Room Callsign\] IS READY \[for taxi/takeoff/point X/etc.\]" | The control room is ready to support test as soon as you get clearance for the next administrative step (taxi, takeoff, etc.), or as soon as you call back with "TEST IS READY" | 1.  "CLEARED TO TAXI"                                                                                                                                                | 1.  Aircrew begin taxi without proper coordination.                                                                                                                                                                        | 1.  "The control room has seen everything necessary before you leave the parking area."                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2.  "CLEARED TO TAKEOFF"                                                                                                                                             | 2.  Aircrew take the runway without proper coordination.                                                                                                                                                                   | 2.  "The control room has seen everything necessary before you leave EOR."                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 3.  "..." (crickets)                                                                                                                                                 | 3.  Aircrew are wondering what's going on.                                                                                                                                                                                 | 3.  Say something/anything.                                                                                                                                                                                         |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| "CLEARED TO MANEUVER"                                                  | Initiate action per the brief for this test point                                                                                                                               | 1.  Saying "CLEARED TO MANEUVER" way too early, i.e. prior to setup, instead of clearing the aircrew to a setup flight condition to prepare for the actual maneuver. | 1.  Confusion ensues about if the test point has actually begun, if aircrew are on parameters, or if clearance has already been issued, requiring a conversation.                                                          | "We are on test point XX. We show good setup. The control room is ready. You are cleared to maneuver."                                                                                                              |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2.  Saying "CLEARED TO MANEUVER" way too late, i.e. the aircrew are waiting and burning gas, or they've already begun the maneuver without your clearance.           | 2.  TC loses control of the mission and the trust/confidence of the aircrew because aircrew have gone rogue, not wanting to burn gas and time waiting for your clearance.                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| "CONCUR"                                                               | I have heard your proposed course of action and I agree with it                                                                                                                 | 1.  "..." (crickets)                                                                                                                                                 | 1.  Aircrew have no idea why they are waiting, if the radios are broken, and generally if you are still alive and breathing                                                                                                | "I agree"                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2.  "CONFIRM"                                                                                                                                                        | 2.  Answering a proposal with a request.                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 3.  "AFFIRMATIVE"                                                                                                                                                    | 3.  Answering a complicated proposal with a simple "yes"                                                                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 4.  "COPY"                                                                                                                                                           | 4.  Aircrew are left wondering you have any opinion.                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

|                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2. +------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| "NEGATIVE"                                                             | No                                                                                                                                                                              | See "AFFIRM"                                                                                                                                                         | See "AFFIRM"                                                                                                                                                                                                               | "No"                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| "ROGER"                                                                | I have heard you                                                                                                                                                                | 1. |                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2. (crickets)                                                                                                                                                     | 1.
